meanings.definition: The quality or state of being burdensome or unwieldy.
meanings.sent1: The cumbrousness of the heavy backpack made it hard to climb the hill.
meanings.sent2: Moving the large furniture alone highlighted the cumbrousness of the task.
meanings.sent3: The cumbrousness of carrying all those books almost made me topple over!
meanings.sent4: The cumbrousness of the bureaucracy slowed down the entire process.
meanings.sent5: The cumbrousness of the old machinery was a constant frustration for the workers.

meanings.definition: The condition of being cumbersome or difficult to manage.
meanings.sent1: The team struggled with the cumbrousness of the new project's requirements.
meanings.sent2: She felt overwhelmed by the cumbrousness of organizing the event single-handedly.
meanings.sent3: The cumbrousness of untangling the Christmas lights always led to a few knots.
meanings.sent4: The cumbrousness of the traffic jam made everyone late for the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The cumbrousness of the paperwork made her desk look like a mountain of forms.
